snippet: A national strike was called by the trade union group Cosatu, a crucial ally of the governing African National Congress that is growing increasingly critical of its policies.
abstract: Tens of thousands of South Africans march in major cities in a national strike called by Cosatu, the powerful group of trade unions, a crucial ally of the governing African National Congress that is growing increasingly critical of its policies; stated reason for the strike is to protest new highway tolls and the practice of contracting out jobs through temporary-employment firms, at lower pay and with fewer benefits than permanent workers get, a practice known here as labor broking.
lead_paragraph: A national strike was called by the trade union group Cosatu, a crucial ally of the governing African National Congress that is growing increasingly critical of its policies.

headline.seo: Powerful Trade Union Group Holds Strikes in South Africa
headline.main: Trade Union Group, A.N.C. Ally, Holds Strikes in South Africa
headline.print_headline: Trade Union Group, A.N.C. Ally, Holds Strikes in South Africa
